page.title: 17WILDLIFE
page.content: There are six main hills and woods in our area: these are Loders Hill, Boarsbarrow Hill, Coneygar Hill, Waddon Hill and Knowle Hill.The nearest hill to us is Boarsbarrow Hill which has a wood on top.It contains mainly pheasants but we have seen buzzards,owls,rabbits,foxes,badgers,sq uirels and a few other rodents and small birds.The biggest animal we saw a roe deer. We tried to follow it but we soon lost it.Right in the centre of Boarsbarrow forest we found a water turret. We discovered that Boarsbarrow contains mainly Scots Pine trees occasionally we saw oak or ash trees. Close to the edge of the forest we saw a young oak tree that all the bark taken off by some deer. One of the mian things we found was a fungus called the common stink horn or wood witch.
